passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Plant-based meat substitutes are becoming increasingly popular. • Companies such as Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods have developed innovative products. • These products aim to mimic the taste, texture, and nutritional value of real meat. • Plant-based meat substitutes can help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and resource consumption.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to highlight the environmental benefits of plant-based meat substitutes?

choices.A: Companies like Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods have made plant-based meat substitutes popular.
choices.B: Plant-based meat substitutes have been developed to closely resemble the taste and texture of real meat.
choices.C: Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods are known for their innovative plant-based meat substitute products.
choices.D: Plant-based meat substitutes can contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and resource consumption.

explanation: D: 'Plant-based meat substitutes can contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and resource consumption' is the correct answer because it effectively uses information from the notes to highlight the environmental benefits of plant-based meat substitutes.
distractor_explanation: 'Companies like Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods have made plant-based meat substitutes popular' is incorrect because it focuses on the popularity of the companies rather than the environmental benefits.
'Plant-based meat substitutes have been developed to closely resemble the taste and texture of real meat' is incorrect because it emphasizes the taste and texture but not the environmental benefits.
'Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods are known for their innovative plant-based meat substitute products' is incorrect because it focuses on the companies' innovation but not the environmental benefits.
